title.rendered: 30 Best 5 Star Hotels near me in Jaipur

content.rendered:
Situated in the northern end of the desert state of Rajasthan Jaipur is a must-visit for all travelers. Lovingly referred to as the pink city, Jaipur is a favorite among tourists from all over the world. Dotted with iconic forts, incredible palaces, one-of-a-kind heritage buildings, and colorful culture, this city of royals will leave a lasting impression. Other than its buildings, Jaipur is also known for its Jewellery, artisans, craftsmen, musicians, and of course, the delectable food collection. One will also hear about the numerous stories and folktales of bravery, courage, and valor by the inhabitants. It’s a place like no other in the world. From Hawa Mahal, Amer Fort, and city palace to Jaigarh Fort, Nahargarh Fort, and Jantar Mantar, every day spent here will be filled with awe and a newfound fascination for the city.

Planning a luxury trip to Jaipur? Pick your choice of hotel from these 30 best 5-star hotels in Jaipur:

List of the 30 Best 5 Star Hotels near me in Jaipur

1. Pearl Palace Heritage


Looking to experience the premium style of Rajasthani hospitality? Make your way to the Pearl Palace Heritage Hotel. Considered as the gateway to Rajasthan it offers a vibrant and exotic feel to your holiday. It is not just another hotel, it offers a deeply moving immersive boutique stay experience. Each of the 20 rooms here displays immaculate and a variety of art forms that are found only in India. It is also an ideal destination to hold your important business meetings or events. Mixing the old-world charm with modern-day sensibilities, this place is a must-book hotel for your next Rajasthani adventure.

Cost: Rs. 5,023

Address: 54, Gopalbari Lane 2, Gopalbari, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.7

2. Samode Haveli


Samode Haveli is an actual palace that was built 225 years ago. Currently serving as a high-end exotic, luxurious hotel in the walled city of Jaipur, Samode occupies the rank for being one of the most iconic places to stay in Rajasthan. These traditional Indian mansions boast verdant gardens, intimate courtyards, and designs you cannot forget. It displays a quintessential indo-saracenic style of architecture. Every corner of this Haveli has a story to tell. The former royal apartments are now converted into high-end deluxe rooms while keeping the rich historical character alive. The private courtyards and stunning balconies overlook the charming pools, fountains, and gardens of the old Haveli.

Cost: Rs. 26,555

Address: Jorawar Singh Gate, Gangapole Road Near, Gangapole, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002

Google Rating: 4.5

3. The Oberoi Rajvilas


Staying true to its name and character the Oberoi Rajvilas is all about luxury, comfort, and impeccable hospitality. This hotel is one of the shining stars of Jaipur with its incredible architecture, regal interiors, and stylish designs. What makes the stay even better is the commitment to make the space look and feel even more luxurious with a massive 32-acre formal lawn. The rooms are deluxe consisting of stylish sunken marble bath tubs that add to the overall opulence. Holiday like a Rajput prince at the Oberoi Rajvilas.

Cost: Rs. 64,458

Address: VVFP+W32, Babaji Ka Modh, Goner Rd, Prem Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302031

Google Rating: 4.7

4. Dera Rawatsar


The Dera Rawatsar Hotel is a boutique hotel that is run by the influential and royal house of Rawatsar whose ancestry can be traced from the Kandhkot Rathore clan of Rajputs. This royal holiday retreat is all about offering a deep relaxing environment in the middle of the city. The serendipitous and peaceful hotel is set amidst historical monuments, shopping areas, and other such heritage buildings. While the exterior of the hotel is exhilarating the interiors are equally awe-inspiring. It blends traditional Indian hospitality along with Indian modernism.

Cost: Rs. 6,048

Address: Bus Station, D -194/C, Vijay Path, behind Sindhi Camp, Kanti Nagar, Bani Park, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302016

Google Rating: 4.5

5. ITC Rajputana


On first look, ITC Rajputana looks like a dreamy palace. Inspired by the imposing traditional Rajasthani architectural styles seen in Havelis here, this 5-star hotel is located in the heart of the city. Offering a deeply immersive stay experience for everyone, ITC Rajputana represents the majesty of the royal era. The entire hotel is decorated with long elegant corridors, stunningly secluded courtyards, and serene fountains. Guests are treated with a typical traditional Rajasthani welcome and hospitality from the moment they step into the premises of this iconic 5-star hotel. Every corner functions as an ode to the spirit of Rajasthan.

Cost: Rs. 17,110

Address: Palace Road, Gopalbari, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302006

Google Rating: 4.7

6. Taj Rambagh Palace


Taj Rambagh Palace is the Taj’s crowning jewel. This iconic luxury 5-star hotel in Jaipur is all about posh, elegance and royal feels. It has often ranked as the number one 5-star hotel in the world. The hotel was originally built in 1835 and has seen many royal families pass through its gates before turning into one of the most luxurious stays in the world. It was also once the home of Maharaja Sawai Man Singh 2 and his queen Maharani Gayatri Devi. The hotel currently offers 78 stunningly restored hotel room suites that are decorated with extravagant hand-carved marble Jalis or latticework. Enjoy the delectable Melas at the best fine dining restaurant in Jaipur. Ideal for a destination wedding or a quick getaway.

Cost: Rs. 70,446

Address: Bhawani Singh Rd, Rambagh, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302005

Google Rating: 4.7

7. Trident Jaipur


Retaining its magnificent royal Rajasthani past, Trident Jaipur is a hotel like none other. Considered to be one of the best and most vibrant 5-star hotels in India, the Trident falls conveniently en route to the famous Amber Fort while also giving stunning views of the Mansagar Lake and Jal Mahal. These views can be best soaked in by booking a stay in one of its rooms. The soothing views work perfectly with all the wellness and recreation facilities the hotel has to offer for the convenience of the guests. Guests can even enjoy some of the most awe-inspiring panoramic views of the Aravali hills that surround the region.

Cost: Rs. 13,570

Address: Amer Rd, Jal Mahal, Amer, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002

Google Rating: 4.4

8. Jai Mahal Palace


The sprawling luxury property of Jai Mahal houses 94 stunning rooms and 6 thematic suites with the sole aim of providing some of the best stay experiences in Jaipur. The antique furniture decorating the entire hotel makes the stay experience here even more opulent than ever. From the Rajasthani motifs encapsulating every corner of the hotel to the miniature paintings, every aspect of the hotel is extremely appealing to the soul. The property is owned by the Taj Group which ensures a wonderfully memorable stay every time.

Cost: Rs. 33,276

Address: Jacob Rd, Civil Lines, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302006

Google Rating: 4.7

9. Fairmont Jaipur


Fairmont Jaipur was built using the traditional architectural styles of typical Grand Mughal Palaces. Glimmering beautifully under the grand splendor of the rugged Aravali Hills, the hotel displays Rajasthani culture and history in its full glory. This 5-star hotel in Jaipur combines the wonderful combination of modern-day comforts and amenities with the glories of the past. This iconic hotel is an exclusive retreat that is ideal for couples, families, and friends looking to have a good time. Every room, suite, nook and cranny at the hotel is skillfully designed combining the classic heritage with some of the most premium amenities available in the country.

Cost: Rs. 14,750

Address: 2, RIICO Industrial Area, Riico, Kukas, Rajasthan 302028

Google Rating: 4.8

10. Shahpura House


The Shahpura Hotel in Jaipur is one of the finest heritage hotels in India. It amalgamates rich history with modern times and offers its guests the best of both worlds. Each room at the Shahpura spells luxury and tradition at the same time. What makes the whole experience even more wholesome is the vintage and heritage furniture decorating the entire property. The heritage property is all about offering an utterly traditional Rajput hospitality that will take you back to the golden era of the Rajas. This erstwhile Haveli has worked perfectly towards taking you back to the time when kings and queens ruled the principality.

Cost: Rs. 8,495

Address: D-257, Devi Marg, Bani Park, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302016

Google Rating: 4.4

11. Alsisar Haveli


Looking for an indulgent holiday to treat yourself? Head to the iconic Alsisar Haveli for recreating that regal charm. This initial majestic mansion belonging to the Thakurs of Alsisar is about providing everyone with a good time. The hotel is like an oasis amidst the chaotic tourist wonder of Rajasthan. The hotel is beautifully grand and elegantly charming with tall ceilings and period decor with stunning courtyards and classy pools. A must-visit here is the grand dining room where the decor, ceiling height, and ambiance are extremely vibey of the olden times.

Cost: Rs. 13,806

Address: Sansar Chandra Rd, Shri Ram Colony, Sindhi Camp, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.4

12. Hotel Arya Niwas


Built as a dream project 35 years ago by a retired engineer, Hotel Arya Niwas is currently one of the top-ranking 5-star stays in Rajasthan. He had a vision of turning his old Haveli into a luxurious stay experience and with the help of his sons he turned it into reality. Ever since the Arya Niwas opened its door to guests in 1983, it has turned into one of the most preferred 5-star hotel options in Jaipur. Housing 128 opulent rooms, impeccable service, and an experience to remember, this hotel is all about displaying the true spirit and colors of Rajasthan.

Cost: Rs. 4,480

Address: Sansar Chandra Rd, behind Amber Tower, Pink City, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.4

13. Umaid Bhawan


Built between 1928 and 1943, Umaid Bhawan Palace in Jodhpur is all about a grand and magnificent stay experience. This stunning piece of Rajasthani heritage is the charming symbol of Jodhpur that attracts luxury holiday seekers from all over the world. Home to the erstwhile Jodhpur royal family, the hotel currently ranks 6th for being the world’s largest private residence. The palace shares one similar factor with the iconic Taj Mahal of Agra, which is the use of white marble for its construction. Set amidst the stunning lush gardens the hotel offers 70 tastefully done, art deco-style rooms that will take you back to the time when royalty was prevalent in the region.

Cost: Rs. 5,697

Address: D1-2A, Via Bank Road, behind Collectorate, Meera Marg, Bani Park, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302016

Google Rating: 4.3

14. The Raj Palace


Situated in the heart of the city center in Jaipur, the Taj Palace is an unmissable wonder. Built-in 1727, the hotel boasts of spellbinding architecture and imposing structures capturing the timelessness of Rajasthani culture. It is also famous as the oldest mansion in Jaipur that was previously named ‘The Chaumoo Haveli’ after the ruler of Chaumoo, Thakur Raj Singh. The hotel has often found its mention in various luxury brand magazines and media as one of the most extravagant and luxurious stays in the pink city. From the moment you step in every guest is welcomed with a royal treatment, soulful folk music, and a refreshing drink while lounging in the exquisite Jhoola seating. The hotel is larger than life in every sense and offers a once-in-a-lifetime stay experience.

Cost: Rs. 30,680

Address: The Raj Palace, Jorawar Singh Gate, Amer Rd, Chokdi Gangapol, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002

Google Rating: 4.6

15. Radisson Jaipur City Centre


Looking for a relaxing stay but don’t want to miss out on the popular tourist destinations in Jaipur? Then head on to Radisson Jaipur. Enjoy a peaceful stay while also being very close to all the popular sightseeing locations. Not just that, the hotel is also in the prime location for transportation connectivity which earns some more brownie points. Enjoy your stay at one of the many stylishly decorated, modern designer rooms with hardwood floors, free Wi-Fi service, and cable TV, along with a plethora of other world-class services. Start your day on a delicious note at the amazing restaurant and go for a wholesome city tour of Jaipur with the help of a concierge.

Cost: Rs. 5,036

Address: Khasa Kothi Circle, Mirza Ismail Rd, Gopalbari, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.4

16. Hilton Jaipur


Located at a convenient distance of just 3.2 kms from the Jaipur railway station, Hilton Jaipur is one of the most preferred 5-star hotel options by travelers from all over the world. A trusted brand name, Hilton is all about offering a good time to everyone. The hotel consists of a wonderful rooftop terrace pool, rejuvenating spa treatment options, and a service that will leave you more relaxed than ever. Other than that the gourmet foods, drinks, and traditional cuisines at the restaurants here will leave a lasting impression in your heart.

Cost: Rs. 7,168

Address: 42, Grand Geejgarh, Hawa Sadak, Geejgarh Vihar Colony, Bais Godam, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302006

Google Rating: 4.4

17. Sujan Rajmahal Palace


The Sujan Rajmahal experience can be easily defined as a transformational stay experience for many. The hotel is famous for infusing modern aesthetics with fine heritage properties. This 19th-century regal retreat makes for the perfect royal stay. The palace offers 13 opulent rooms and suites displaying the perfect mix of classic and contemporary styles. The hotel further elevates its vibe with the presence of an art deco-style swimming pool, serene gardens, and stylish interiors. The walls of the palace also tell the grand story of Rajasthan making it an oasis for everyone, including art lovers and history enthusiasts.

Cost: Rs. 59,000

Address: Sardar Patel Marg, Shivaji Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.7

18. Hotel Kalyan


Hotel Kalyan is one of the most affordable 5-star experiences in the pink city of Jaipur. The hotel opened its doors in 1981 and ever since then it has earned its name in the industry for its immaculate hospitality and on-point customer service. The traditional architecture in the hotel reminisces the grand past while the modern amenities allow the guests to experience the best of Rajasthani hospitality. All 35 rooms are equipped with modern-day amenities, vintage art, and hand-crafted unique paintings with an emphasis on quality. From leisure to business trips, the hotel can host everyone.

Cost: Rs. 1,742

Address: Hathroi Fort, Ajmer Rd, Hathroi, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.2

19. Jai Niwas Garden Hotel


Jai Niwas is located conveniently in the central part of the pink city. This is a family-managed establishment that is a stunningly renovated bungalow. Offering the perfect combination of value for money along with modern amenities and friendly services, the hotel is iconic in every sense. The hotel offers typical homemade food which is supervised by the owners and makes the stay even more unforgettable. Other add-on services like free Wi-Fi, parking, travel arrangements and more make a holiday at Jai Niwas truly worth it. The rooms are available in different price ranges but each stay here is extremely comfy and heart-warming.

Cost: Rs. 2,912

Address: Gopinath Marg, Mirza Ismail Rd, near GPO, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.4

20. Sajjan Niwas


The grand property is owned by the Shekhawat family of the Nangal principality. The royal vibes are eminent throughout the hotel, from its dome-shaped ceilings, grand spaces, and typical Rajasthani heritage decor. The 32 rooms of the hotel cater to travelers and tourists of all price ranges. Each room is distinct from the other, they are well-ventilated, designed to please the traditional aesthetics, and of course the grand balconies make the stay even more royal. A helpful staff works as an icing on the cake.

Cost: Rs. 2,091

Address: D1/2 B, Behind Collectorate, Banipark, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302016

Google Rating: 4.2

21. Hotel Rajasthan Palace


Located very close to the airport, hotel Rajasthan palace is an ideal stay for many tourists. Along with the comfortable stay, the hotel also offers a range of modern amenities like a grand swimming pool, open garden, wide spaces for weddings, etc. The cuisine restaurant serves some of the best-tasting authentic Rajasthani dishes. It ranks among one of the top 10 best hotels to stay in the pink city. What’s more, is that the hotel offers attractive package deals for sightseeing and other related activities. Head to Hotel Rajasthan Palace where you can experience a royal stay but within budget.

Cost: Rs. 6,878

Address: 3, Peelwa Garden, Rajasthan Palace Hotel, Moti Doongari Road, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302004

Google Rating: 4.7

22. Royal Heritage Haveli


Built in the 18th century, the royal heritage Haveli was built by his highness Madho Singh the 2nd of Jaipur. It opened its doors 250 years after its construction as one of the most iconic heritage hotels in Jaipur. It has carried forward its glorious legacy of opulence and hospitality which was established during the era of maharajas. All of the 19 suites and rooms are dedicated solely towards providing a tranquil and peaceful haven for everyone. The hotel is especially known for its personalized hospitality experience, plush interiors, serene courtyards, and more. Escape the mundane everyday life and swap it for being treated like the royals at the royal heritage Haveli.

Cost: Rs. 16,467

Address: Plot No. 116 & 117, Near Khatipura Tiraya, Khatipura, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302012

Google Rating: 4.4

23. Atithi Guest House


Atithi Guest House is a unique heritage stay in the heart of Jaipur just between the old walled city and train station. It is a family-run establishment consisting of 22 well-furnished rooms topped off with every modern amenity imaginable. The rooms are bright, airy, and well-decorated while also giving a feel of being at home. Try out delectable cuisines at the rooftop multicuisine restaurant or spend some peaceful time at the well-maintained lawns and courtyards. The impeccable customer service makes the whole stay experience all the more memorable.

Cost: Rs. 1,232

Address: No 1, Park House Scheme, opposite All India Radio, Sindhi Camp, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.4

24. Jaipur Marriott


Looking for an escape from the bustle of the pink city but don’t want to compromise on the 5-star treatment? Jaipur Marriott is just the place for you. It is perfectly located in the cultural heart of the pink city and offers the perfect mixture of luxury with convenience for every traveler. The suites are designed elegantly with close attention to detail in every aspect of the design. With timeless opulence and contemporary comfort, Jaipur Marriott ranks among one of the top-rated 5-star hotels in Rajasthan.

Cost: Rs. 9,735

Address: Ashram Marg, Near, Jawahar Circle, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302015

Google Rating: 4.5

25. Suryaa Villa


Bordering various tourist attractions of Jaipur, Suryaa Villa is a resplendent reminder of the rich and royal heritage that Rajasthan is still known for. Plastered on the walls of this hotel are the stories that make Jaipur a city wonderment in every sense. The doors of this villa were opened to redefine luxury for every guest who walks through the doors. The soothing oasis of this villa displays traditional Rajasthani architecture through its lush courtyards and refreshing pools. The villa was once the abode of the Peelwa family and covers a massive area of 50,000 sq. ft. one can experience the true and the real essence of the royal life.

Cost: Rs. 8,400

Address: C-2, Peelwa Garden, Moti Doongri Rd, near NIMS, Anand Puri, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302004

Google Rating: 4.2

26. Khatu Haveli


The Khatu Haveli occupies the heart of the walled city of Jaipur. Just half a km away from the train station, Khatu Haveli is also placed strategically close to the iconic tourist attractions of Hawa Mahal and Jantar Mantar. Built in the mid-19th century, the Khatu Haveli has been maintained by the following 6 generations of the royal lineage that followed. The Haveli structure is a typical Rajasthani bungalow complete with well-maintained courtyards and appealing structures. From the arches and the verandahs to the enthralling views of the Nahargarh fort the Haveli is the perfect stay option for everyone looking to have an authentic Rajasthani vacation.

Cost: Rs. 4,648

Address: WRH6+XQG, Uniyara ka rasta, Chandpole Bazar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.3

27. Krishna Palace


The Krishna Palace is one of the rare gems of Jaipur that has even found its mention in the prestigious travel book, The Lonely Planet. This heritage building which was previously a palace is all about offering a nice, peaceful time to every guest. The rooms are clean and spacious with extra care given to hygiene. The gardens here are wide and very well maintained. Krishna Palace is situated at walking distance from the train station it has managed to retain its original glory through its well-preserved architecture and warm interiors. The rooftop restaurant here also works wonders in offering a memorable time.

Cost: Rs. 1,429

Address: E-26, Durga Marg, near Collectorate Circle, Subash Nagar, Sen Colony, Bani Park, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302016

Google Rating: 3.9

28. Pandya Niwas


Pandya Niwas is all about offering a simple, elegant, and classy stay option. It is one of the rare pet-friendly stays in Jaipur that is also just a km away from the city palace. The hotels consist of 9 rooms in all and are all equipped with the latest and state-of-the-art modern amenities that make your stay experience worth it. If you wish to experience a slow-paced stay with all the conveniences then Pandya Niwas is just the place for you. The restaurant here not only offers authentic Rajasthani cuisines but also a range of vegan options to accommodate as many travelers as they can.

Cost: Rs. 2,016

Address: 2091, Nahargarh Rd, opposite Lal Hathi Mandir, Chandpole, Pink City, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001

Google Rating: 4.1

29. The Lalit Jaipur


The Lalit is one of the premier luxury hotels in Jaipur. This iconic 5-star hotel is just minutes away from the airport and other major cultural attractions. The hotel is inspired by the local architecture and displays the finest blend of traditional and contemporary styles. The hotel boasts 231 sleek and stylish spacious rooms and suites that travelers can choose from. The lobby sheds some light into the stunning history and culture of Jaipur through its unique ambiance created by fine Katni marble appointments and hand-designed floors.

Cost: Rs. 12,077

Address: Jawahar Circle 2B & 2C, Jagatpura Rd, near Jagatpura Road, Malviya Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302017

Google Rating: 4.4

30. Nahar Singh Haveli


The Nahar Singh Haveli is a family-owned establishment that is all about providing tourists with the best and the most authentic Rajasthani stay option. Located at a convenient distance from some of the major tourist attractions of Jaipur, the hotel comes equipped with 19 stunningly decorated and traditionally posh rooms. From the gorgeous marble flooring to the vintage fireplace, this haveli is truly like no other in Jaipur. The heritage property is extremely comfortable and perfect for tourists looking to have a fun, relaxing, and budget-friendly stay in Jaipur while also soaking in the sights and sounds of the iconic pink city.

Cost: Rs. 1,344

Address: 46, Kanti Nagar, Sindhi Camp, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302006

Google Rating: 4.6

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q1. When Is The Best Time To Visit Jaipur?

Ans. October to March is the best time to visit Jaipur.

Q2. Are 2 Days Enough For Jaipur?

Ans. Yes. 2 days are sufficient to explore Jaipur.

Q3. What Should I Wear In Jaipur?

Ans. Make sure to wear clothes that are appropriate to deal with hot and humid weather conditions. Preferably apparel that is light and skin-friendly.

Q4. Which Is The No. 1 Tourist Place In Jaipur?

Ans. Hawa Mahal is the no. 1 tourist place in Jaipur.

Q5. Which Is The Closest Railway Station To Jaipur?

Ans. The Jaipur Junction railway station is the closest to the city of Jaipur.
